page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF WHITEGATE
page.content: The village of Whitegate is a predominantly rural area. The main occupation seems to be farming and there is also a little industry. The industries tend to be related to agriculture. The quarrying removes the sand from the land and so makes it able to keep the moisture. This makes the land better for farming, because the grass does not dry up and is better for the cows. The meat processing centre at Hartford obtains its meat from beef farms. The main place of historical interest is Vale Royal Abbey. At the entrance to the Abbey there was once a white gate and this is how the village got its name. The leisure facility is mainly the golf club and Pettypool. Whitegate has been conserved with care and is full of interesting things to see.
